byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Susanne Craig, Kristin Hussey, Thomas Kaplan, Angela Macropoulos, William K. Rashbaum and Nate Schweber. Susan C. Beachy contributed research.
byline.original: By KIRK SEMPLE and DAVID W. CHEN

abstract: Those associated with Adam Skelos, who has been charged with corruption along with his father New York Sen Dean Skelos, describe youth in shadow of his father as he struggled to find his way; some suggest younger Skelos, who jumped between schools and jobs, felt unable to escape path already defined for him.
lead_paragraph: Since his arrest, the portrait of Mr. Skelos, 32, that has emerged is one of a young man whose life seemed to lose traction during late adolescence and who struggled professionally.

headline.main: One Constant for Adam Skelos in a Life of Stumbles: His Powerful Father
headline.print_headline: In Skelos Case, a Son Whose Life Seemed to Lose Traction Early

snippet: Since his arrest, the portrait of Mr. Skelos, 32, that has emerged is one of a young man whose life seemed to lose traction during late adolescence and who struggled professionally.
